title: Former Bachelorette star Rhys Chilton unleashes on 'fat people' in bizarre rant
text:
Former Bachelorette star Rhys Chilton has launched a bizarre attack on 'fat people who keep justifying their weight.'

Taking to Instagram stories on Sunday, the 33-year-old insisted that it shouldn't be acceptable to promote being overweight as 'nobody loves curves.'

'It turns out creating a positive movement was easier than just eating healthy and working out,' he wrote alongside a picture of a plus size model.

'Don't sit next to me on a plane': Former Bachelorette star Rhys Chilton (pictured) has launched a bizarre attack on 'fat people'

He continued: 'Dudes don't have a movement promoting beer guts as attractive. It's as if we understand it's not healthy.'

'It's okay to love your body even if you're overweight. But don't promote it as something to idolise.'

Rhys than insisted people should stop 'trying to justify being overweight as excess fat is exactly that.'

'If your mental fortitude is strong enough then you'll eat better and work out, if it's not then the next level of mental fortitude is being 'body positive,' he said.

Rant: Taking to Instagram stories on Sunday, Rhys insisted that it shouldn't be acceptable to promote being overweight

He added: 'Nobody out there loves their curves more than they'd love being actually in f***ing shape.'

'I'm not shaming fat people, I'm shaming people who are lying to themselves and society about fat people.'

He ended: 'You can be fat... I don't care. Just don't sit next to me on a plane, don't have four heart attacks costing tax dollars and don't expect me to swipe right on you.'

Controversial: Rhys also said people should stop 'trying to justify being overweight. Excess fat is exactly that'

He wrote: 'Just don't sit next to me on a plane, don't have four heart attacks costing tax dollars and don't expect me to swipe right on you'

This isn't the first time Rhys has launched a bizarre attack on social media as earlier this year he unleashed his frustrations on vegans and vegetarians.

In a rant posted to Instagram, he mocked gym-goers who follow a plant-based diet.

He said: 'If you're vegan or vegetarian and trying to do the gym thing, there is a really good way you can get your protein after a workout.

'Just grab yourself a fork and a whole chicken and dig the f**k in. It's f**king good s**t.'

authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
